unnormalised: **Question:** What are the best exam prep apps available for Indian students, especially for competitive exams like JEE and NEET?
normalised: **Question:** What are the best exam prep apps available for Indian students, especially for competitive exams like J E E and N E E T?

unnormalised: Okay folks, let's talk exam prep apps! As a former IIT aspirant (failed miserably, BTW!), I can tell you the right app can be a lifesaver. Forget those bulky coaching center notes; we're in the age of digital!
normalised: Okay folks, let us talk exam prep apps! As a former I I T aspirant (failed miserably, by the way!), I can tell you the right app can be a lifesaver. Forget those bulky coaching center notes; we are in the age of digital!

unnormalised: For JEE and NEET, apps like Vedantu, Unacademy, and Physics Wallah (PW) are super popular. They have live classes, mock tests, and tons of practice questions – basically everything you need. PW especially is known for its affordable courses; you can even find crash courses starting at just Rs. 2500!
normalised: For J E E and N E E T, apps like Vedantu, Unacademy, and Physics Wallah (P W) are super popular. They have live classes, mock tests, and tons of practice questions – basically everything you need. P W especially is known for its affordable courses; you can even find crash courses starting at just rupee two thousand five hundred!

unnormalised: For bank exams like SBI PO or IBPS, Adda247 and Oliveboard are great. They focus more on speed and accuracy, which is crucial for those exams. Plus, they often have quizzes that simulate the real exam environment. Imagine practicing those tricky quantitative aptitude questions on your commute to work in Mumbai!
normalised: For bank exams like S B I P O or I B P S, Adda two hundred and forty seven and Oliveboard are great. They focus more on speed and accuracy, which is crucial for those exams. Plus, they often have quizzes that simulate the real exam environment. Imagine practicing those tricky quantitative aptitude questions on your commute to work in Mumbai!

unnormalised: Don’t ignore general knowledge apps like GKToday, either. Knowing your current affairs is essential for many exams. I used it religiously before my UPSC attempt (also a glorious failure!). Pro tip: set a reminder to read it every morning at 09:00 hrs.
normalised: Do not ignore general knowledge apps like G K Today, either. Knowing your current affairs is essential for many exams. I used it religiously before my U P S C attempt (also a glorious failure!). Pro tip: set a reminder to read it every morning at zero nine hundred hours.

unnormalised: My suggestion is to download a few free trials and see what works best for you. Remember, the best app is the one you'll actually use consistently! Happy studying and good luck for your exams on 26/01/2024 or whenever they are scheduled! Also, many apps have free mock tests on 15/08 every year.
normalised: My suggestion is to download a few free trials and see what works best for you. Remember, the best app is the one you will actually use consistently! Happy studying and good luck for your exams on twenty sixth January two thousand and twenty four or whenever they are scheduled! Also, many apps have free mock tests on fifteenth August every year.
